comments.commentBody: We see what we want to see in the collection. There are two photographs from Baltimore (check April). There are also several other photographs depicting the lives of blacks. These photographs may not come from the vantage point you would prefer, but a nurse in Liberian helping save lives, a strong Serena Williams, a black couple getting married are all positive representations of black lives. And that matters, too.

Ethics require that every lawyer provide the best possible defense to whomever they represent without regard to their own personal opinion or public sentiment. Perhaps you are unaware that John Adams, perhaps the greatest of all American patriots, represented British soldiers on trial in the case of the Boston Massacre. John Adams faithfully represented the British soldiers, not because he approved of the British intervention in Boston, but rather because he was dedicated to the law and the notion that everyone deserved a fair trial.
Lone wolves - or a culture which condones violence?

These video clips show an incredible hatred of this woman in particular and women in general. I suspect that this hatred is of tribal origin and less so of Islamic origin, although the two might work together as both tribal customs and Islamic belief are hostile to women (as are Judaism and Christianity at their respective core).

SD: I can't believe you asked how the 1% are profiting.  Perhaps you believe that the military-industrial complex works as a non-profit charity for the country?  Take off your tin hat and reread the comment through an objective lens.

"Los Angeles initially required that students earn at least a C in those classes, but the number of students on track to graduate plummeted. Now grades of D or higher are accepted." - NYTimes
That trend would continue into the college so more talent development programs in colleges to get these students up to speed in college are getting popular. I am afraid the value of a college diploma won't be as worthy as before. We need to educate today's students to become tomorrow's citizens who can think and make good decisions for themselves and their families.

37% of the US population has an IQ of 95 or less. And half the population is less than average. How do we fix this? Or can it ever possibly be changed?
Let's face it, we aren't generally turning out college bound material.
The most educated people are having only 1 or 2 children. The bottom half are multiplying more rapidly therefore we've got a general population with a decreasing level of IQ. So in short yes, we are becoming more stupid.

I like Sanders for raising important issues. I have donated money to him and will vote for him in the primary because he brings important issues to the table. But I will just as enthusiastically vote for Clinton for President and it is idiotic to lump Clinton in the same camp as the Republicans. Besides, I totally despise Bernies (non) policy on gun control.

We have given 50 years of affirmative action -- time to end it.  And foreign students tend to have much higher test scores than African Americans AND pay full tuition.  Equal access should mean an equal competition but not necessarily equal outcomes.

I followed the dough recipe exactly and the filling mostly. I had leftovers I was getting rid of and also didn't have everything on hand. The dough was easy to work with and filling came out great! I made the empanadas bigger and brushed them with egg yolk bc I think they look prettier that way. Also served with sour cream which offset the spicy chorizo (I added more than recipe called for). Green olives were a nice addition but of course you can vary the filling endlessly.

What specifically in the documentary exemplifies shoddy journalism?   I just saw an interview with one of the reporters behind it and she seemed very professional, articulate and informed.  She also pointed out that for all his outrage, Manning did not deny HGH being delivered to his wife and challenged other reporters to specifically press Manning and others on that one very important point.

Yes, there are nagging questions. But unfortunately, the Al Jazeera documentary does not answer any of them. Has this NYT reporter watched it? It is shoddy journalism, which is a shame since this is such an important topic. Just because the story might be true doesn't mean Al Jazeera had the goods to report it. CBS learned that with Rathergate, and Al Jazeera is about to learn it again, the hard way.
Football without steroids is like hockey without steroids. No?

Except that HGH provides more performance-enhancing than healing, the reason it is banned!

Are you really under the delusion that players take this for their healing qualities?

You probably still believe Lance never drugged either?
I have no argument with what you've said, but HGH usage in any context is still banned by the NFL.  That would beg the question, what's your point?
Did you watch the documentary, including the doc who explained the three, Very limited therapeutic uses of HGH?

There is a huge difference between using HGH to recover from an injury and using it as a performance-enhancing drug.  There are many drugs that have great value in a therapeutic context that are prohibited for other uses.
Although to be fair: http://www.cbsnews.com/news/steroids-prescribed-to-nfl-players/ etc etc

Striking that it takes outsider news orgs like AlJazeera or, in the case of Biogenesis, a Miami alt-weekly, to investigate drugs in major league sports. Hmm, why might 60 Minutes not be eager to look under the hood of the football games driving their ratings? Meanwhile I wonder if MLB will devote the same resources to investigating a drug ring based in Indiana and Austin that it devoted to busting mostly Latin players in Miami. I think they probably will follow this up pretty hard. The NFL -- a whole other story. I'm not holding my breath for them to follow up.
Too much money -- too many incentives not to dope -- just ask Barry Bonds.
Guess you don't follow or understand sports. Why did you read it?

All will be forgotten if they win a Super Bowl. Perhaps a wake-up call to their fallibility will be a good thing. We've seen an unbeaten team enter the Super Bowl in recent memory with an appalling level of hubris before, and their fall from grace was far more painful than what transpired tonight.

Karma seems to punish hubris badly - better to take your blows early and finish strong.

The Cardinals have been the best team in the NFL for awhile, now.  After this week, the pundits will have no choice but to admit it.  They are late to the table.  The Cards have had the best margin of victory since maybe week 3.   When you badly outscore quality competition on a regular basis and the critics find reasons to rate other teams higher, you know that the critics are looking for a reason to rate weaker teams above the best team in the NFL.
Yes ... but if they beat the Jets and Pittsburgh wins (assuming Denver finishes ahead of the Jets) it will be another off season of recriminations for us and Rex Ryan will have happy feet.
The fact that the Jets have a new QB and the old Darrelle Revis might also have something to do with their resurgence in 2015.
That a boy Here, keep the negative vibes flowing it's the only way the Jets can win , but I doubt it.

A shout-out for nose-to-the-grindstone Todd Bowles and coaching staff and their never-say-die players, along with a quick reminder to purported football fans Donald Trump, Chris Christie and their ilk that, if anything, blowhardism is overrated:

BUFFALO BILLS
2014: 9-7 (without Rex Ryan)
2015: 7-8 (with Rex Ryan)

NEW YORK JETS
2014: 4-12 (with Rex Ryan)
2015: 10-5 (without Rex Ryan)

With one regular-season game left (fittingly against the Bills), the Jets not only control their own destiny, but have managed to do so without a loudmouth coach. How refreshing.
CASF  -  Before you go off the deep end you might want to consider that the next president will almost surely appoint one or two members to the Supreme Court.

.
ELkE -- I consider you an authority on clues/entries that consist of feminine names following the vowel-L-consonant-vowel pattern! But Deb's knowledge of "Casablanca" may exceed even your knowledge of those 4-letter names. Deb knows "Ilsa Lund" as well as she knows ILSA's spouse's name and as well as she knows the real name of the actor portraying Ugarte.

Accordingly, I believe this is like the "sqwushed" calamity, where Deb submitted correct copy only to have it uncorrected by emus.

I continue to wonder why someone would use ELSE in a grid when they could just as easily use ELkE? Sure, the STS theme could play a role, but still!

" I fear her presence will mobilize the right in ways that no one truly anticipates."....Not very likely, Obama (being born in Kenya) has already done that far beyond anything Hillary could possibly do.

.
You both get recos from me, but that's all I can add to this thread.

My brain is too full of playoff permutations. Harvard graduate Ryan Fitzpatrick told the media that the JeTS juST need to "take care of business", but 2 Denver losses plus a STeelerS win would be just as good.

Further meaningless STatiStic heard this morning on Will ShorTz'S radio show: Counting cable, broadcast, and online channels, 409 "scripted series" aired in 2015.

I've given more money to Bernie than to any candidate in my life, but I don't buy the need to tear down Hillary to build up Bernie. Why do the GOP's dirty work for them? (Yes, I get it that negative attacks work. Nevertheless).

Great questions. As far as I can tell, the New York Times, the so-called "paper of record", is covering Clinton and Trump far more than other presidential contenders.

Amy Chozick covers Clinton on an ongoing basis. From what I've seen (I might be wrong), I don't think that any other candidate has a dedicated Times correspondent.
